document_type: ISO 27001 Security Requirements - Annex A Control
applies_to_note: All gambling operators subject to RTS Chapter 4 - Security Requirements

control.control_purpose: To ensure access to information and other associated assets is defined and authorised according to business requirements
control.control_objective: Manage the full lifecycle of access rights in accordance with organization's topic-specific access control policy and rules

iso_27001_definition.official_text: Access rights to information and other associated assets should be provisioned, reviewed, modified and removed in accordance with the organisation's topic-specific policy on and rules for access control.
key_requirements: Access rights provisioned in accordance with policy
Access rights reviewed in accordance with policy
Access rights modified in accordance with policy
Access rights removed in accordance with policy
Full lifecycle management of access rights

access_rights_overview.definition: Access rights are permissions and authorizations that control what an entity (user, system, service) can do with information and other associated assets

relationship_to_controls.identity_management_5_16: Identity determines WHO is accessing - identity is account/login
relationship_to_controls.authentication_information_5_17: Authentication proves the identity - password/multi-factor authentication
relationship_to_controls.access_control_5_15: Access control establishes rules for access based on information classification
relationship_to_controls.access_rights_5_18: Access rights assign specific permissions to specific identities based on business need

implementation_requirements.description: Access rights must be authorized by the owner of the information or asset being accessed

details.authorization_source: Asset owner makes final determination of who gets access
details.asset_owner_definition: The person responsible for the information or asset
details.principle: Asset owner understands their data and who needs access to it

implementation_requirements.requirement: Base Access on Policy and Business Requirements
implementation_requirements.description: Access rights must be granted based on organization's topic-specific access control policy and actual business requirements

details.principle: Access must be justified by policy and business need
elements: Policy defines roles and access levels
Business requirement specifies what access needed
Access rights granted only where both policy and business requirement align
No access granted without documented business justification
details.alignment: Access rights must be consistent with information classification and role requirements

implementation_requirements.description: Separate the person requesting access from the person authorizing and granting access

details.principle: Segregation of duty prevents abuse of access granting
parties_involved: Authorizer - asset owner or manager approving
details.requirement: Requestor cannot be the sole authorizer or implementer
details.benefit: Provides check and balance on access provisioning

implementation_requirements.description: Access rights are only provided after formal authorization, not before

details.requirement: No provisional access granted with intention to complete approval after
details.correct_approach: Complete approval process first, then provision access
details.incorrect_approach: Grant access then complete audit trail after the fact
details.timing: Authorization must be completed and documented before access provisioning occurs
details.audit_trail: Approval must be in place and documented prior to access being granted

implementation_requirements.requirement: Provide Access for Required Duration Only
implementation_requirements.description: Access rights are provided for as long as needed and removed when no longer required

details.principle: Time-limited access based on business need
details.duration_determination: Business need determines how long access is needed
details.ongoing_access: Access continues as long as business need exists
details.removal_trigger: Access removed when business need no longer exists
details.review_process: Regular review determines when access no longer needed
details.efficiency: Minimizes rights in use, reduces risk

implementation_requirements.description: Access rights are removed when a person leaves the organization

trigger_events: Role change resulting in no further need
details.process: Leaver process must include removal of all access rights
details.timing: Access should be removed on or before last day
details.completeness: All systems, applications, and assets must have access removed
details.verification: Audit that all access was removed

implementation_requirements.requirement: Manage Third Party and Supplier Access
implementation_requirements.description: Suppliers and third parties are provided temporary access for specific time periods

details.principle: Time-limited, purpose-specific access for external parties
approach: Access removed when no longer needed
details.example: Third party contractor fixing issue granted access for fix duration, then access removed
details.documentation: Business case for third party access and duration documented
details.removal: Must be actively removed - not expected to expire automatically

implementation_requirements.description: Records of who has access to what are maintained and managed

details.documentation: Keep audit trail of all lifecycle events
details.protection: Protect access records as sensitive information

implementation_requirements.description: Reviews of access are carried out regularly to verify access still appropriate

details.review_frequency: Regular reviews conducted at defined intervals
details.privileged_accounts: Review more frequently for privileged accounts
review_scope: Identify orphaned accounts or unnecessary access
details.action: Remove access found to be no longer needed

implementation_requirements.description: Account cloning should be avoided due to risk of incorrect permissions

details.practice: When creating new accounts, temptation to clone existing accounts
details.risk: If source account has been modified or over-privileged, cloned accounts inherit those issues
details.danger: All cloned accounts end up with superuser access or excessive permissions
details.caution: If account cloning must occur, take great care with permission verification
details.best_practice: Create accounts fresh based on role requirements rather than cloning

implementation_requirements.description: Role-based access is a great mechanism for managing access and should be considered

details.mechanism: Group permissions by role rather than assigning individually to each user
details.implementation: Define roles, assign users to roles, grant permissions to roles
details.recommendation: RBAC should be considered for all significant systems

access_rights_lifecycle.description: Standard process for managing access rights through complete lifecycle

stages.name: Request Access
stages.description: User/manager requests access based on business need

stages.name: Authorize
stages.description: Asset owner and appropriate authority authorize the request
details: Verifies requestor is different from authorizer

stages.name: Provision
stages.description: Access rights are granted and configured

stages.name: Review
stages.description: Access rights periodically reviewed to verify appropriateness

stages.name: Modify
stages.description: Access rights changed based on business requirements or review findings

stages.name: Remove
stages.description: Access rights removed when no longer needed
details: Triggered by leaver process or role change
All access removed from all systems
Account may be disabled or deleted

steps.detail: Document access control policy defining roles, access levels, and rules
Determine who owns each information asset or system
Define roles and corresponding access rights for each role

steps.action: Implement Access Request and Authorization Process
steps.detail: Create formal process with segregation of duty
Document all current access rights and users
Implement or configure systems to grant access as authorized
Create schedule for regular access reviews (quarterly minimum)
Establish process to remove all access upon employment termination
Educate staff on access request process and responsibilities
Document all access rights procedures with version control

compliance_checklist.description: Steps to comply with ISO 27001 Annex A 5.18

checklist.item: Define access rights based on roles and business need
Implement access request and authorization process
Enforce segregation of duty in access approval
Implement provisioning of access after authorization
Establish schedule for regular access reviews
Conduct more frequent reviews for privileged accounts
Implement leaver process to remove access
Manage third party and supplier access

common_mistakes.description: Top 3 mistakes organizations make with access rights

mistakes.mistake: People have left but they still have access
mistakes.description: Access not removed when personnel or third parties leave the organization
mistakes.impact: Security risk - departed personnel retain access to systems and data
mistakes.prevention: Implement and rigorously follow leaver process
mistakes.action: Ensure access is current and departed personnel no longer have any access
mistakes.audit_risk: High - easiest win for auditor, results in immediate finding

mistakes.mistake: Third parties have open-ended access they do not need
mistakes.description: Third parties granted continuous access rather than time-limited, purpose-specific access
root_cause: No process for third party access
mistakes.example: Third party brought in to fix issue - given permanent access instead of temporary fix access
mistakes.correct_approach: Grant access only when needed for specific purpose, remove when purpose complete
mistakes.prevention: Process must grant access when required and remove when not needed
mistakes.best_practice: Time-limited, purpose-specific access for all third parties

mistakes.mistake: Document and version control is wrong
mistakes.description: Poor document version control and maintenance of access rights procedures
issues: Version numbers don't match where used
prevention: Keep document version control up to date
Ensure version numbers match where used
mistakes.impact: Shows lack of control and organization

audit_requirements.description: What auditors will check during ISO 27001 A 5.18 audit

audit_areas.description: Auditor checks that access rights procedures are documented and followed
checks: Authorization process documented with segregation of duty
Recent hires have access approval documentation
Granted access matches what was requested and approved
Access authorization in place before provisioning
Audit trail of access lifecycle maintained
audit_areas.easiest_win: Request admin/privileged accounts from systems - likely to find unnecessary, orphaned, or unauthorized accounts (9 out of 10 times)
audit_areas.best_practice: Maintain documented evidence of all access lifecycle activities

audit_areas.description: Verify administrative and privileged account access is appropriate and necessary
checks: Auditor requests explanation for each admin account
Verification that each admin account is still needed
Verification that admin holds each account is correct
No orphaned or forgotten admin accounts
No admin accounts for departed personnel
audit_areas.frequency: More frequent audits for privileged accounts
audit_areas.risk_focus: Auditors focus here as admin access poses highest risk

audit_areas.description: Verify documented procedures exist, are followed, and personnel are trained
checks: No access remains for departed personnel
audit_areas.biggest_gotcha: People with access who have left - evidence of no leaver process or process not followed
audit_areas.red_flag: Former employee or contractor accounts still active

audit_areas.description: Verify regular access reviews are conducted and documented
checks: More frequent reviews for privileged accounts
Review scope covers all systems and assets
Access removal actions documented from reviews
No access found that is no longer needed

audit_areas.description: Verify access rights are tracked and documented
checks: Segregation of duty evident in authorization
Third party access documented and time-limited
All documents classified and labelled appropriately
audit_areas.warning: Poor documentation is a massive own goal

ukgc_application.critical_systems_context: Access rights management is critical to protecting all gambling systems - controls who can do what with information and assets

access_rights_requirements: Strict role-based access control to customer data
Minimal personnel with access to payment card information
Read-only access where possible
Approval required from data owner for all access
Quarterly access reviews for customer data access
Privileged access removed upon role change
Third party vendor access time-limited and audited
Segregation of duty in access authorization
Access audit trail for all customer data access
Minimal personnel with RNG system access (principle of least privilege)
All RNG access pre-approved and documented
Segregation of access - RNG development, testing, monitoring separate
Different access for RNG implementation vs. RNG validation
Monthly access reviews for RNG systems
No overlapping access across critical RNG functions
Immediate access removal if role no longer involves RNG work
Third party RNG vendor access strictly time-limited
Complete audit trail of all RNG access
Read access separated from write access
Approval required for any write access to game results
Audit trail of who accessed what and when
Access to audit trail itself controlled
Quarterly reviews of game state modification access
Role-based access aligned with job functions
No administrative access to game results data
Immediate access removal for separated personnel

specific_requirements.system: System Access Points and Entry/Exit Controls
access_rights_requirements: System access provisioning authorized before granted
All system access documented and registered
Access rights tied to specific systems and functions
Regular reviews of system access rights
Third party system access time-limited
Service account access managed per identity/authentication lifecycle
Network access rights based on network segmentation
Different access rights for different network zones
VPN access rights authorized and limited
Remote access differentiated from local access
Network service account access controlled
Quarterly review of network access rights

ukgc_application.compliance_requirement: Operators must implement comprehensive access rights management for all critical systems with role-based access, formal authorization, regular reviews, and documented audit trails

compliance_notes.overall_purpose: Manage complete lifecycle of access rights to ensure only authorized entities have access to information and assets they need for legitimate business purposes
compliance_notes.enforcement_priority: Critical - access rights control what users can actually do once authenticated
key_principles: Business justification required for all access
Segregation of duty in access approval
Time-limited access based on business need
More frequent reviews for privileged access
Third party access temporary and purpose-specific
Complete audit trail of all access lifecycle events

to_pass_the_audit.description: To comply with ISO 27001 Annex A 5.18 Access Rights, implement the following

requirements.requirement: Implement process for creating, updating and removing access rights
requirements.detail: Formal documented process covering all lifecycle stages
Asset owner must approve all access provisioning
Separate requestor, authorizer, and implementer roles

requirements.requirement: Base access on policy and business requirements
requirements.detail: Access granted only where policy and business need align
Authorization completed before access is granted
Document all users and their access rights
Conduct reviews at defined intervals, more frequently for privileged accounts
Remove all access upon employment termination
Time-limited, purpose-specific access for external parties
Group permissions by role where possible
Maintain updated documentation with version control
Educate staff on access request and approval process

prerequisite_controls: ISO 27001 A 5.1 - Policies for information security
dependent_controls: ISO 27001 A 6.5 - Responsibilities after termination or change of employment
related_iso_controls: ISO 27001 A 9.4 - Physical and logical access restrictions
cross_references: Access Control (A 5.15) - establishes rules for access based on classification
Identity Management (A 5.16) - manages identities to which access rights assigned
Authentication Information (A 5.17) - proves identity gets assigned access
Privileged Access Rights (A 8.2) - manages elevated access rights

authorization_best_practices: Asset owner signs off on all access requests
Verify segregation of duty in all approvals
Document business justification for all access
Review and approve before provisioning occurs
provisioning_best_practices: Document what was provisioned and when
review_best_practices: Include user managers in review process
Remove access found no longer needed
removal_best_practices: Remove access on or before last day
Archive removed user data per policy
rbac_best_practices: Assign users to roles rather than individual permissions

high_risk_areas.risk: Excessive access to customer payment information, personal details, account balances
high_risk_areas.control: Minimal personnel with access, read-only where possible, frequent reviews

high_risk_areas.risk: Access to RNG systems could allow manipulation of game fairness
high_risk_areas.control: Strictly limited access, segregation of duties, monthly reviews, no overlapping access

high_risk_areas.risk: Elevated privileges could allow unauthorized modifications to systems and data
high_risk_areas.control: Minimal admin access, segregation of duties, frequent privileged account reviews

high_risk_areas.risk: Departed personnel retaining access poses ongoing security risk
high_risk_areas.control: Rigorous leaver process, verification of all access removal

high_risk_areas.risk: Extended vendor access beyond needed duration
high_risk_areas.control: Time-limited access, documented business case, active removal

regulatory_expectations: UKGC expects sophisticated access rights management
Principle of least privilege strongly emphasized
Role-based access control expected for large gambling operations
Access audit trail required for all systems
Compliance approach should document access rights for each critical system
